conclusion: Read the coordinates of points A and B from the P-V plot; both lie on the horizontal line p = 1 × 10⁵ Pa (isobaric process); Volume at A: V₁ = 3 L = 3 × 10⁻³ m³; Volume at B: V₂ = 4 L = 4 × 10⁻³ m³
Calculate the change in volume for A → B: ΔV = V₂ – V₁ = (4 − 3) L = 1 L = 1 × 10⁻³ m³
In an isobaric process the work done by an ideal gas is W = p ΔV
Insert the numerical values (in SI units): W = (1 × 10⁵ Pa)(1 × 10⁻³ m³) = 1 × 10² J
The external work performed by the gas while expanding from state A to state B is 100 J
